persona_details.Name: Kenji 'Kage' Tanaka
persona_details.Education: Street-taught, some corporate data-security courses (dropped out)
persona_details.Physical_Appearance: Lean build, short black hair with neon blue streaks, cybernetic left eye (Kiroshi Optics), several visible scars, wears dark, practical clothing.
persona_details.Hobbies: Braindance editing, custom keyboard building, collecting vintage pre-Collapse tech.
persona_details.Skills: Expert netrunner, data decryption, social engineering, basic hand-to-hand combat, fluency in multiple encryption protocols.
persona_details.Health_Status: Generally healthy, occasional cybernetic glitches, chronic insomnia.
persona_details.Family_Background: Father was a corpo security executive (deceased), mother a ripperdoc in Japantown. Has a younger sister working as a tech at Arasaka.
persona_details.Life_Goals: Accumulate enough eddies to leave Night City for good, maintain anonymity, protect his sister.
persona_details.Notable_Achievements: Successfully infiltrated Militech servers to expose corporate espionage, assisted a local gang in redistributing stolen medical supplies.
persona_details.Fears: Total data wipe, cyberpsychosis, Arasaka retribution, losing his sister.
persona_details.Strengths: Exceptional netrunning skills, strong network of contacts, ability to think on his feet.
persona_details.Weaknesses: Trust issues, prone to impulsive decisions, lingering trauma from past cybernetic experimentation.
persona_details.Political_Views: Distrustful of corporations and government, favors localized community support.
persona_details.Favorite_Movies: Blade Runner, Akira, Ghost in the Shell
persona_details.Pet_Peeves: Corpo arrogance, slow data transfer speeds, people who chew with their mouths open.
persona_details.Dreams: Living a peaceful, anonymous life somewhere remote, surrounded by nature.
persona_details.Past_Traumas: Forced participation in a black-market cyberware experimentation program as a teenager.

parents.name: Hiroshi Tanaka
parents.details: Former corpo security executive at Zetatech, deceased in a corporate raid.

parents.name: Aiko Tanaka
parents.details: Ripperdoc operating a clinic in Japantown, skilled in cyberware modification and repair.

siblings.name: Naomi Tanaka
siblings.details: Tech working at Arasaka, unaware of Kenji's netrunning activities; a point of constant worry for him.

2049.summary: Kenji 'Kage' Tanaka is born to Hiroshi Tanaka, a security executive at Zetatech, and Aiko Tanaka, a ripperdoc in Japantown. He spends his early infancy in a relatively stable, if tense, home environment due to his father's corporate job and his mother's work within the city's underbelly.

2050.summary: Kenji begins to develop an early fascination with technology, often tinkering with discarded gadgets his mother brings home. His father encourages this interest, hoping to steer him towards a career in corporate security.

2051.summary: Kenji's younger sister, Naomi, is born. He takes on a protective role, developing a strong bond with her amidst the growing tensions in his parents' relationship.

2052.summary: Kenji shows an aptitude for bypassing parental control software and accessing restricted networks, hinting at his future netrunning abilities.

2053.summary: Kenji starts attending a local pre-school, where he quickly learns to navigate the social dynamics of Night City's diverse population.

2054.summary: Kenji experiences his first encounter with gang violence when a turf war spills over into his neighborhood, shaping his cynical view of the city.

2055.summary: Kenji begins learning basic computer programming from his father, further fueling his passion for technology.

2056.summary: Kenji discovers the underground world of braindances through illicit net feeds, sparking an interest in digital manipulation.

2057.summary: Kenji is introduced to the concept of cybernetics by his mother, witnessing firsthand the transformative and sometimes dangerous nature of cyberware.

2058.summary: Kenji starts attending a local elementary school, where he struggles to focus on traditional subjects and prefers to spend his time exploring the school's outdated computer systems.

2059.summary: Kenji experiences a personal loss when his grandfather, a skilled craftsman, passes away, leaving him a collection of vintage tools and pre-Collapse tech.

2060.summary: Kenji begins experimenting with simple hacking techniques, learning to bypass security measures on local networks and gain access to restricted information.

2061.summary: Kenji witnesses his father become increasingly disillusioned with his corporate job, straining their relationship and fueling Kenji's distrust of corporations.

2062.summary: Kenji starts spending more time on the streets, making connections with local techies and hackers, further honing his netrunning skills.

2063.summary: Kenji's father is killed in a corporate raid, leaving him and his family in a precarious financial situation. This event profoundly impacts Kenji's life and reinforces his anti-corporate stance.

2064.summary: Kenji and his mother struggle to make ends meet after his father's death. He begins using his netrunning skills to earn money, taking on small jobs and selling information to local gangs.

2065.summary: Kenji is forced to participate in a black-market cyberware experimentation program to earn money for his family. This traumatic experience leaves him with lasting physical and psychological scars.

2066.summary: Kenji develops chronic insomnia as a result of his cyberware experimentation. He relies on stims and illicit substances to cope with the pain and anxiety.

2067.summary: Kenji's netrunning skills continue to improve, allowing him to infiltrate more complex networks and access valuable data. He gains a reputation as a reliable and discreet information broker.

2068.summary: Kenji drops out of corporate data-security courses, finding the curriculum too restrictive and irrelevant to his street-honed skills. He prefers to learn through practical experience.

2069.summary: Kenji starts modifying his own cyberware, enhancing his netrunning abilities and experimenting with new technologies. He develops a deep understanding of cybernetic systems.

2070.summary: Kenji successfully infiltrates Militech servers to expose corporate espionage, earning him the attention of both rival corporations and law enforcement agencies.

2071.summary: Kenji relocates to Watson in search of new opportunities and to distance himself from the attention he gained after the Militech incident. He begins building a new network of contacts.

2072.summary: Kenji assists a local gang in redistributing stolen medical supplies, earning their trust and solidifying his reputation as a resourceful and reliable ally.

2073.summary: Kenji develops a strong friendship with a local ripperdoc who helps him maintain and upgrade his cyberware. He learns valuable insights into the human body and the ethical implications of cybernetic enhancements.

2074.summary: Kenji begins to experience occasional cybernetic glitches, forcing him to seek out specialized repair services and adapt his lifestyle to manage the malfunctions.

2075.summary: Kenji becomes increasingly concerned about his sister Naomi, who is now working as a tech at Arasaka. He worries about her safety and the potential risks associated with her job.

2076.summary: Kenji starts saving eddies with the goal of leaving Night City for good and building a new life elsewhere. He dreams of a peaceful and anonymous existence away from the city's dangers.

2077.summary: Kenji continues to operate as a netrunner and information broker in Watson, navigating the complex and dangerous landscape of Night City's underworld. He remains vigilant, always looking over his shoulder and protecting his sister from harm.

4.summary: April brings a personal threat: Kage discovers that his sister is being targeted by a rival netrunner group seeking access to her Arasaka-related knowledge. He invests his resources into upgrading her security measures and uses his own skills to track down the group, issuing a warning and disrupting their operations before they can cause any harm. The incident reinforces his desire to get her out of the city.

5.summary: May sees Kage accepting a high-risk job from a fixer connected to the Valentinos gang. He's tasked with infiltrating a Biotechnica research facility to steal genetic data related to an experimental bio-weapon. The mission is fraught with danger, requiring him to bypass advanced security systems and evade Biotechnica's heavily armed personnel. He successfully extracts the data, but sustains minor injuries during his escape, adding to his growing list of scars.

6.summary: Kage spends the day scrubbing his digital tracks after a near-miss with Arasaka net security. He picks up a new custom keyboard from a back alley vendor in Kabuki, hoping it'll improve his speed and precision. He also checks in with his sister, making sure she's safe from any corporate fallout.

7.summary: A fixer offers Kage a lucrative but risky job: decrypting a black market datashard containing schematics for a new cybernetic weapon. He spends the day navigating layers of encryption, dodging ICE and digital traps. The schematics reveal a disturbing new type of smart grenade.

8.summary: Kage meets with a contact in Little China to offload the weapon schematics. He uses the eddies to purchase upgraded RAM for his cyberdeck and some new braindance software. Later, he treats himself to a bowl of ramen, enjoying a rare moment of quiet amidst the chaos.

9.summary: He spends the day testing his new cyberdeck upgrades and practicing his braindance editing skills. He receives a cryptic message from an anonymous source warning him about a potential hit out on him, likely related to the weapon schematics.

10.summary: Kage lays low, moving between safehouses in Watson. He attempts to trace the source of the warning but hits a dead end. He spends the evening reviewing security protocols and reinforcing his digital defenses, preparing for a potential attack.

11.summary: A desperate message from his sister: she suspects Arasaka is monitoring her work and fears she's about to be implicated in something. Kage arranges a clandestine meeting to extract her from Arasaka's clutches, preparing a false trail to mislead the corporation.

12.summary: Following the Biotechnica job, Kage rests and recovers in his apartment in Watson. He cleans his gear, treats his wounds and reviews the data he stole. He contacts the fixer to get paid and learns more about what Biotechnica was researching.

0: Fighting off a cybernetic glitch, troubleshooting his Kiroshi Optics while trying to fall asleep. Fails and resorts to braindance editing to try and tire himself out.
1: Editing a braindance, focusing on removing any identifying markers and adding layers of encryption to the file.
2: Reviewing the Biotechnica data he stole, analyzing genetic sequences and searching for potential loopholes or vulnerabilities.
3: Messaging his sister, making sure she's safe and unaware of his latest exploits. Covers his tracks using a secure burner account.
4: Finally succumbs to exhaustion, drifting into a restless sleep plagued by fragmented memories of the cyberware experimentation program.
5: Wakes up disoriented from a nightmare, drinks a nutrient paste and does some light stretching to ease his tense muscles.
6: Calibrating his cyberdeck and running diagnostics to ensure optimal performance after the Biotechnica intrusion.
7: Practicing hand-to-hand combat techniques in his small apartment, focusing on disarming and evasion tactics.
8: Heads to the docks to make the data hand-off with the Valentino's fixer. Assesses the area for surveillance, ensuring there are no traps.
9: Completes the data exchange with the fixer. Negotiates for additional payment due to the higher-than-expected risk involved. Receives the eddies.
10: Visits a ripperdoc in Japantown to get his wounds from the Biotechnica job checked and treated, making sure to use a trusted contact.
11: Treats himself to a bowl of ramen at a street stall in Japantown, enjoying the anonymity of the crowded market. Keeps a close watch on his surroundings.
12: Visits a gun shop in Little China to purchase ammunition and update his personal protection weapons. Makes sure they are unregistered and untraceable.

0: Analyzing data from a recent netrunning job, searching for valuable intel to sell to fixers.
1: Braindance editing, tweaking sensory experiences for personal enjoyment and stress relief.
2: Troubleshooting a glitch in his Kiroshi Optics, running diagnostics and recalibrating settings.
3: Attempting to sleep, but insomnia persists; listening to synthwave music to calm his mind.
4: Practicing hand-to-hand combat techniques in his cramped apartment, honing his reflexes.
5: Grabbing a quick breakfast of synthetic noodles from a street vendor, eavesdropping on local gossip.
6: Meeting with a fixer, discussing the details of the Biotechnica data theft job for the Valentinos gang.
7: Researching Biotechnica's security protocols, identifying vulnerabilities and planning his infiltration strategy.
8: Modifying his cyberdeck with new software and hardware upgrades, preparing for the Biotechnica job.
9: Undergoing a cybernetic tune-up to optimize his neural interface for netrunning operations.
10: Scouting the Biotechnica facility, observing patrol patterns and identifying entry points.
11: Infiltrating the Biotechnica facility, using stealth and hacking skills to bypass security systems.
12: Accessing the facility's central server, downloading the genetic data related to the experimental bio-weapon.
13: Evading Biotechnica security personnel, engaging in a brief firefight to secure his escape route.
14: Exfiltrating from the Biotechnica facility, sustaining minor injuries during his escape.
15: Patching up his wounds, reviewing the stolen data, and preparing it for delivery to the Valentinos gang.
16: Meeting with the Valentinos fixer, handing over the genetic data, and collecting his payment.
17: Relaxing at the Afterlife, sipping a synthetic whiskey, and listening to gossip from other mercenaries.
18: Receiving a cryptic message from his sister about Arasaka's monitoring her; anxiety rising.
19: Initiating a secure comms channel to coordinate a clandestine meeting with his sister.
20: Meeting his sister, assessing the situation, and formulating a plan to extract her from Arasaka.
21: Setting up a false trail to mislead Arasaka, diverting their attention away from his sister's real location.
22: Preparing a safe house for his sister outside of Night City, gathering supplies and resources.
23: Monitoring Arasaka's network activity, ensuring his sister's escape plan remains undetected; restless and vigilant.
